    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.lang.String inputFileName)
                throws InvalidAutomata,
                       java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: FiniteAutomata
        Performs the initialization of the FA. Basically the implementation of this method must read the FA definition from the given inputFileName and construct the FA.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface FiniteAutomata
        Parameters:
        inputFileName - Name of the file which contains the definition of the FA. This file MUST reside within the 'input' directory.
        Throws:
        InvalidAutomata - when the definition of the FA is invalid
        java.io.IOException - when reading the definition from the file fails

      • validateInput

        public boolean validateInput(java.lang.String input)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: FiniteAutomata
        Performs validation of a String according to the Finite Automata definition provided
        Specified by:
        validateInput in interface FiniteAutomata
        Parameters:
        input - String which contains the expression that has to be validated
        Returns:
        True if the expression is valid and False otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when this method is called prior to the invocation of FiniteAutomata.initialize(String) method
